p: In order to evaluate the electronic changes associated with electronic excitation and excitation induced structural deformations, Fig. 7 shows the modifications of the projected density of states for the monoclinic LTO crystal under 0.8% electronic excitation, without and with excitation induced structural deformations. While Fig. 7(a) shows the same characteristics than Fig. 6(a) but to a lesser degree, Fig. 7(b) indicates that the formation of O 2-like molecules in the structure, as induced by electronic excitation, tend to reduce the number of O 2p unoccupied and partially filled states near the Fermi level. The structural distortions also play a role in lowering the energy of unoccupied Ti 3d states, which contributes to reduce the energy gap between unoccupied O 2p and Ti 3d states of the material compared to the pristine monoclinic LTO.
